overview: Sunset Park Prep is a caring community school dedicated to helping individual students grow through interactive learning and a broad range of experiences designed to create well-rounded students. Prep aims to ignite intellectual curiosity and to prepare all students for high school and beyond, with particular attention paid to the social-emotional needs of adolescents. In addition to a rigorous curriculum, Prep also provides a variety of enrichment opportunities, from after-school clubs to exciting trips and experiential learning opportunities. Parents appreciate that students, staff, and families support each other to ensure an atmosphere where educational excellence flourishes. The principal's open door policy welcomes parents to speak with her; the bilingual parent coordinator works closely with parents; and teachers are available through PupilPath (Prep's online grade book), phone, and email. Student/Teacher planned events, from Global Awareness Week and Community Week to Family Science, Reading, and Math Nights, celebrate our tight-knit school community.

overview: M.S. 839 engages students in meaningful units of study that prioritize student-centered, inquiry-based learning experiences, real-world expeditionary experiences, and interdisciplinary connections. All students participate in a broad range of arts, music, language, and technology coursework throughout each year at M.S. 839. State-of-the-art facilities and our close proximity to Prospect Park provide students with hands on learning in all content areas. Students are supported through a comprehensive system of individualized supports. Each teacher serves as a crew leader to a small group of students, meeting daily and serving as the key contact person between the school and families. M.S. 839 is committed to creating an authentic collaboration with all constituents. The school seeks to build upon the diversity of the students, families, and staff by celebrating and leveraging their cultures and languages to create a truly inclusive school culture.

overview: Our school has established the following goals: increase the number of students who are proficient in ELA and Math, organize classes to reflect the diverse needs of the student body including the Scholars Program, engage in parent orientations at the start of each school year in addition to family engagement opportunities every Tuesday to foster parent relationships, and offer a Specialized High School preparation program. To achieve these goals, we cultivate a safe social-emotional learning environment through the implementation of Restorative Practices. Students enjoy Restorative Circles weekly with their peers. An abundance of after-school opportunities are conducted through a partnership with SASF, Monday through Friday. The Student Council has branded our school as the Blue Jays and our proud basketball and cheerleader teams confidently sport that symbol on their uniforms! The 66 Rock Band and the Middle School Urban/Architect artists work in tandem to keep the arts an integral part of the school experience. Finally, 2017 marks the first year that our school will administer the Living Environment Regents.

overview: I.S. 68 is a school that provides its students with a high-quality education that surrounds Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics (STEAM). We are a certified Eco-School and are a part of the Billion Oyster Project. Our students learn about science and technology through our pollinating garden and school-wide air purifying initiative. We pride ourselves on our newly implemented robotics program which uses state-of-the-art equipment and 3-D printing. I.S. 68 has a belief system based on Steven Covey's The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People in which students demonstrate positive behavior by being proactive, setting goals, collaborating, and prioritizing. We have a strong focus on student leadership development which is supported by the Leader in Me program. Students also benefit from various partnerships. For example, through our partnership with Long Island University, students have opportunities to visit colleges and universities around the country.

printedschoolname: The East Flatbush Community Research School
overview: Our vision is to create a safe environment in which authentic learning experiences build character and empower students to become independent thinkers. Our mission is to provide a Common Core Learning Standards (CCLS)-aligned curriculum, life skills, mentorship, interventions, and enrichment activities that will enhance learning and support the social-emotional growth of our students. At EFCRS, we focus on targeting individual needs. We possess a strong community of teachers who are committed to motivating, engaging, and providing rigorous learning experiences. Our parents appreciate the strong focus on instruction, smaller class sizes, and two and a half hours of expanded-day programming our school offers. Students enjoy the cultural exposure and the unique courses in expanded day. Unique academic offerings include: Algebra Regents Course, Specialized HS Test Prep, and Saturday Academy. Unique expanded-day offerings include: STEM Academy, Robotics, Coding, Cooking, Soccer, Chorus, Drumming, and Theater.

overview: The Lenox Academy offers an academically accelerated program for middle school students. We provide a high-quality education within a learning environment that supports young learners. Lenox Academy's rigorous academic program, coupled with a highly skilled and experienced staff, has proven successful. Approximately 25 percent of our 8th grade students from the class of 2016 were accepted to specialized high schools. Most have received acceptances to select public high schools, others have accepted placements in private day and boarding schools through scholarships granted by Prep 9. Lenox Academy promotes academic excellence and challenges students to meet NYS standards with distinction. Over 90 percent of our students met standards [Level 3] or met standards with distinction [Level 4] on the 2015-2016 New York State Standardized exams. All of our seniors are administered the English Language Arts Common Core Regents, Living Environment Regents, and Spanish Proficiency exams. A select group of students are administered the Algebra I Regents. Our SONYC after-school program offers expert instruction in martial arts, culinary arts, dance, theater, basketball & volleyball, and photography.

overview: Our Performing Arts Program provides students with a strong sense of discipline and responsibility. Our teachers take advantage of the natural curiosity, energy, and enthusiasm of sixth through eighth graders. The program supports students at different levels of maturity and includes a balance of teacher-structured and student-initiated activities. The Performing Arts program provides training for beginning and experienced students in dance, drama, instrumental band, steel pan orchestra, and vocal music. The courses represent a selection of introductory classes together with those that fulfill the needs of highly talented young artists. The curriculum focuses on basic skills, a disciplined manner of inquiry, individual creativity, and good study habits. Students are encouraged to work cooperatively and to share their special gifts and talents.

printedschoolname: The Science And Medicine Middle School 366
overview: The Science and Medicine Middle School (SMMS) uses health and medicine as a lens through which students learn core academic subjects, including mathematics, science, social studies, and English language arts. SMMS equips young people with the knowledge and skills to manage their own health and well-being, advocate for community members, and pursue post-high school education preparing them for careers related to health and wellness. We believe that students can, and should, shape their health, education, professional futures, and communities. To that end, SMMS uses a student-centered approach to learning which highlights student voice and engagement as priorities throughout our school. Through our partnerships with universities, hospitals, and other medical facilities, we enable our students to travel on their life's path to high school, post-secondary education, and careers.

printedschoolname: Middle School for Art and Philosophy
overview: Students at the Middle School for Art and Philosophy (MSAP) engage in a variety of units of instruction throughout the year. Our instruction is concept-based, interdisciplinary, and Common Core-aligned. The infusion of visual arts and applied philosophy courses makes our program unique. Our 21st Century Community Learning Center after-school partnership provides access to the arts through mural painting and a jazz band. We have continued our chorus through a partnership with the Brooklyn Arts Council. Our Elders Share the Arts Program connects students with elders in the community. MSAP students have been invited to perform at The Brooklyn Arts Council's annual fundraiser, the Urban Arts showcase, and a number of other venues. What students like most is that their teachers provide a nurturing environment though a small school structure that holds them accountable for their work and their actions through continuous support and opportunities for improvement.

printedschoolname: Middle School of Marketing and Legal Studies
overview: Students at the Middle School of Marketing and Legal Studies (MLS) are immersed in basic marketing and legal studies coursework that compliments the station based, student centered learning that is aligned with the Common Core standards. Additionally, MLS is the only school in District 18 that offers intense preparation for three out of the five high school Regents exams (Algebra, Living Environment & US History) that students will take at the end of their eighth grade year. Through engagement in events such as our annual college tour or career day, students are exposed to a multitude of opportunities to explore their interests and create college- and career-driven goals. Our community partners provide direct support in navigating the high school application process and helping students gain acceptance into the best-fit schools for themselves. MLS proudly supports the other enrichment activities essential to our student's middle school experience through our monthly spirit days, annual Broadway Jr. productions, and our track program that produces some of the top middle school athletes in the nation. MLS also has a merit system that allows students to accrue merit points towards monthly prizes or the interactive incentive room.

overview: At the Brooklyn Science and Engineering Academy, we believe that early exposure to science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) will support students' overall academic growth, develop their critical-thinking and reasoning skills, and enhance their interest in STEM study and careers. We engage young learners by having them assume the roles of scientists, authors, researchers, engineers, and mathematicians–thus preparing them to compete and succeed in high school, college, and beyond. Hands-on, real-life learning projects will guide instruction and engage our students. Through our partnership with St. John's University, students will have access to STEM-based resources and receive an early college experience. To facilitate the transition from elementary to middle school, we provide a daily advisory class that is grounded in mindfulness, positive behaviors, and goal-setting.

overview: All students are encouraged to participate in school activities and community service as well as to develop meaningful relationships with adults in our school. Students enjoy the availability of interesting classes and after-school activities. There is an enrichment program to fit each student’s needs. Parents appreciate our various methods of making the home/school connection. We communicate with parents using the school messenger system which notifies parents of school events over the telephone, emails, and mailings. In addition, we provide informational workshops for parents. Parents also enjoy our new Parent Center which is complete with computers, a color printer, and comfortable seating. Our parent coordinator and community assistants are available to demonstrate Skedula, Acuity, and Access web-based programs for families. Parents/Guardians also like our principal’s open door policy, where they have an opportunity to meet with the principal, academy principals, and school staff.

overview: Our school is a community of instructional innovation that provides choices and options for young people to become critical thinkers and lifelong learners in an environment of care and respect. Our goal is to meet the need of every young person through collaboration, opportunity, and experience. Catherine and Count Basie Middle School is one of the best-kept secrets of District 28. Our school staff is committed to providing a high-quality and meaningful educational experience for each child. The school's environment supports students, parents, and staff in an effort to offer every child an opportunity for an excellent education. Our curriculum includes specialty courses, advisory courses, elective courses, and a range of extracurriculars, all within a challenging curriculum. We provide students with the opportunity to take educational excursions, visit colleges and universities, interact with political officials, and use their voices to impact change in our ever-changing society.

overview: We follow the EL Education (eleducation.org) model, in which students engage in learning expeditions and have multiple opportunities for hands-on learning. Students participate in fieldwork experiences with experts in a variety of fields (activists, authors, scientists, doctors, etc.) that take them outside of the classroom and give them a chance to experience the concepts they are learning. Students receive a strong background in science, technology, and sustainability and have multiple opportunities after school to apply the ideas learned in class to real-world projects. Parents play a major role in the school, from attending student-led conferences to being chaperones and participants for fieldwork to contributing to various school committees. Students belong to crews, which are small advisory groups with an advisor. Students participate in a four-day wilderness/backpacking adventure.

overview: Students like our diverse, collaborative school community dedicated to achieving academic excellence for all students. Our nurturing environment fosters a family of lifelong learners. We pride ourselves on delivering challenging and engaging lessons as well as offering a multitude of activities to develop a well-rounded child. We offer Regents courses, Multiple Foreign Language courses, a full talent program which includes fine arts, band, chorus, dance, and drama courses. Students as well as parents appreciate the extra help and support available. We embrace our multicultural student body where we have a 100% respect for 100% of people, 100% of the time philosophy. All students from sixth, seventh, and eighth grade are encouraged to participate in Student Council because it provides them the opportunity to get involved. In addition, students have the opportunity to be inducted into the National Junior Honor Society (NJHS) and participate in the Mathcounts Competition. We have a state-of-the-art science lab, a newly renovated student-friendly library, two computer labs, multiple computer carts, and a brand new fully-furnished dance studio. We have an active Parent Association whose members work tirelessly for the good of our school.

overview: Students like our technology-based education. They use their laptops in class to take notes via the use of Google Docs, do research, and create iMovies, PowerPoints, class wikis, and class blogs. Through our Green Magnet Educating for Sustainability curriculum, students are involved in studying about, and taking actions in, their local and global communities. Students also like the wide range of in-class programs and after-school activities we offer. Parents appreciate our parent education classes and the school's communication efforts, including many opportunities for parental involvement. We utilize a web-based communication portal called PupilPath that permits parents and students to track student academic and behavior progress daily and in real-time. Laptops and additional digital devices are utilized in all classrooms. Our school community is diverse, with over 40 nations represented. We have a greenhouse, pollinators' garden, and an organic vegetable garden on our campus.

overview: Vision: The Vision of York Early College Academy (YECA) is to develop the next generation of forward-thinking, tenacious leaders who are socially responsive to their communities. Mission: The mission of York Early College Academy (YECA) is to provide a highly supportive and academically challenging learning environment for traditionally under-served, but strongly motivated students with high potential for future academic and career success. Upon entering sixth grade, college and career preparation is introduced and continually communicated to all students while progressing through a rigorous curricula and instruction centered on critical thinking, research, communication, professional writing, and problem-solving. Our mission will be actualized in an environment where trust is cultivated amongst students, teachers, administrators, staff, parents, and the community. Core Values: Service, Perseverance, Advocacy, Reflection, and Collaboration.

Parents appreciate the regular communication they receive through email, phone blasts, text messages, and the school's gradebook system. Additionally, online gradebooks show students' grades in real-time, including homework and test scores–parents will also be emailed when a student misses homework. Parents also appreciate the school's frequent college tours, and our partnership with Queens Community House, The City University of New York (CUNY), and numerous Advanced Placement courses.

overview: Redwood is a small middle school that offers students exciting academic opportunities including STEM coursework, Regents courses in eighth grade, and foreign language. Students are strongly encouraged to sign up for our after-school program which runs from 3:10pm-6pm. During this time, students engage in both academic work and enrichment clubs. Advisory groups work together on identifying school, community, and global issues and creating service learning projects around those issues. Students also participate in week-long mini-courses called Inquiry Explorations. Inquiry Explorations are intended to challenge students through in-depth immersion in compelling topics like stereotypes in fairy tales, forensic science, and photography. These courses will include fieldwork, use of experts, and product development geared towards audiences in and outside of school.

printedschoolname: The Young Women's Leadership School, Queens
overview: The Young Women's Leadership School (TYWLS), Queens is structured to give each young woman individualized attention. We focus on nurturing the academic, social, and developmental growth of our students. We expect our students to go above and beyond the New York City and New York State school graduation requirements as we prepare them for college. Our parents appreciate the personalized attention their family receives. We use PupilPath, a web-based communication system, to inform our parents of their daughter's academic progress. Parents also appreciate the Summer Bridge Enrichment Program for incoming sixth grade students. The Young Women's Leadership Network (YWLN) and the CollegeBound Initiative provide a full-time CollegeBound counselor. Students are immediately exposed to colleges, college fairs, and expectations beginning in sixth grade.

overview: The Academy for New Americans offers newly arrived immigrant students and their families the opportunity to adjust successfully to their new setting. The program offers a specialized curriculum that facilitates the acquisition of the English language through a one-year programmatic option. Our school is committed to providing the following services to our students: a welcoming climate that is conducive to English language acquisition, a specialized curriculum that focuses on English language proficiency, an environment that promotes self-esteem and addresses the needs of early adolescence, an introduction to the New York City school system, an emphasis on becoming familiar with American culture, computer literacy classes, support services such as counseling and tutoring, and a committed, well-trained staff that guides the students through the transition period as they become acclimated to our multicultural society.
